cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 240 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest across the central Gulf toward the Louisiana coast, then forecast to turn north and eventually northeast across the Lower Mississippi Valley and Appalachians during the 5-day period
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely near Houma/Intracoastal City area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and hurricane watches/warnings confined to the northern Gulf Coast from Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the AL/FL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning Intracoastal City, LA to Mouth of the Pearl River; Storm-surge warning Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA to AL/FL border including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (Boston not listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected; only breezy conditions possible when the remnant low passes well south of New England late week
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Massachusetts coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–2 inches of rain to eastern New England around 3–4 Sep
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor urban/poor-drainage flooding possible from residual rainfall
